sourcesContent:
import React, { useEffect, useState } from "react"; import Youth from "../assets/youth.avif" import Older from "../assets/OlderAdults.avif" import Latinx from "../assets/LatinX.avif" import Depression from '../assets/Depression.avif' import Anxiety from '../assets/Anxiety.avif' import BIPOC from '../assets/BIPOC.avif' import WarningSigns from '../assets/WarningSigns.avif' import Suicide from '../assets/SuicideCat.avif' import Translation from './TranslationEngToSpan/Mental.json' export const CategoriesMental = (props) => { const { language } = props // const [language,setLanguage]=useState("spanish") const [content, setContent] = useState({}) useEffect(() => { if (language === "english") { setContent(Translation.english) } else if (language === "spanish") { setContent(Translation.spanish) } }, [language]) return (

{content.translate355} {/* More On */} {' '} {content.translate36} {/* Mental Health */}

{/* More info on major mental health topics and conditions */} {content.translate37}

{/* Depression */} {content.translate38}

{content.translate39} {/* Major depression is one of the most common mental illnesses, affecting more than 21 million of American adults each year. */}

{content.translate40} {/* Anxiety */}

{content.translate41} {/* Anxiety disorders are among the most common mental illnesses in America; over 42.5 million of adults are affected by these debilitating illnesses each year. */}

{/* Suicide */} {content.translate42}

{content.translate43} {/* The majority of suicides worldwide are related to mental health disorders; depression, substance use, and psychosis are the biggest risk factors. */}

{content.translate44} {/* BIPOC Mental Health */}

{content.translate45} {/* Mental Health Resources For Black, Indigenous, And People Of Color */}

{content.translate46} {/* Warning Signs */}

{content.translate47} {/* It is especially important to pay attention to sudden changes in thoughts and behaviors. Also keep in mind that the onset of several of the symptoms below, and not just any one change, indicates a problem that should be assessed. */}

{content.translate48} {/* Latinx Mental Health */}

{content.translate49} {/* It is important to look at how culture can add to mental health stigma in the Latino community. A lack of understanding and acceptance of mental illness keep many from speaking about their problems and getting professional care. */}

{content.translate50} {/* Older Adults */}

{content.translate51} {/* Depression is often under-recognized and under-treated in older adults. Without treatment, depression can impair an older adult’s ability to function and enjoy life, and can contribute to poorer overall health. */}

{content.translate52} {/* Youth */}

{content.translate53} {/* The first “basic” is to know that children’s mental health matters. We need to treat a child’s mental health just like we do their physical health, by giving it thought and attention and, when needed, professional help. */}

); };
